Resident
2017 Not Recommended Reviewed 09/13/2017
I'm only a few months into my lease and I'm afraid I made a horrible decision. The leasing consultants changed since I moved in 3 months ago. The new leasing consultants have nasty attitudes and poor customer service skills. They misplace packages, they don't give proper notice about repaving the parking lot, and they never apologize when they make mistakes. The condition of the apartments are disgusting and dirty. I should have known when they never showed me my apartment before move in that there would be problems. There were stains in every room. The paint job was sloppy at best. Everything was old except the new carpet and linoleum. I wouldn't recommend this complex if it were the last habitable place on Earth. Save your money and go somewhere else.

Report
Verified Resident
2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 08/28/2017
My biggest complaints about the apartment are that 1) the fitness center is small, 2) some of the maintenance issues that I put in a week ago have yet to be fixed, and 3) there is hair from previous residents stuck to the walls because it appears that painters painted over the hair. #1 will be changing soon enough - the managers told me that they are going to start expanded the fitness center soon. #2 isn't really the end of the world. The maintenance workers are nice and hardworking (I appreciate them!) - there just appear to be some flaws in the system. And #3, well I don't have much to say about that. I can't do anything to make that part better and it grosses me out a little bit. Other than #3, I would consider the apartment very clean and livable for the price.

Report
Verified Resident
2015 - 2017 Not Recommended Reviewed 08/16/2017
It's been a varied experience. This community has changed management multiple times quickly, so it's difficult to really rate my experience because the company responsible for it now can't do anything about a bad experience I had with a company two years ago. I'm a little baffled as to why management has changed hands so many times-- first it was MAA, then it was someone else, then Pegasus, now Blue Ridge-- and nobody has been able or willing to tell me why. I've stayed here as long as I have because the rent has been comparatively VERY cheap, and the location is excellent. My neighbors have been lovely. But as rent is rapidly rising, the incentive for me to stay is disappearing. I have no complaints so far with Blue Ridge, because they haven't been in management long enough to mess anything up. I will say this, though. My apartment flooded last Christmas, to the point where I had to be placed in a hotel for 3 days while they cleaned it. There is still quite a bit of water damage around the bottom of the walls, and the maintenance staff who replaced my carpet and cleaned left plenty of marks and dents in the walls which I'm afraid will be blamed on me. The apartment was under management by Pegasus at that time, so Pegasus knew that I did not cause the damage , and now it's under Blue Ridge. So I'm afraid Blue Ridge will not know the whole story. This is my major problem with management changing so many times. Hopefully BR will stay put.

The community is very quiet and allows for plenty of activities for you, your family, and pets. The location is great, being next to the Southpoint Mall area, as well as college campuses. The lake is also very lovely. As far as the living space itself, the apartments are very spacious, even the smaller apartments. They're very neat and clean, and the setup of everything is nice. The only issue I have is that the walls are a little thinner than I'd like, but the neighbors aren't horrible with noise, so it's not so bothersome. Overall, this is a good place to be.

Report
Verified Resident
2016 - 2017 Not Recommended Reviewed 05/11/2017
I had a negative experience living at this apartment complex. There was an unorganized change of management during my lease, which made a lot of changes that were not communicated well to residents. This included how to pay rent, how to get mail/packages, and trash. These were the main issues that I encountered. There suddenly was a $25 fee to pay rent online, so I had to go back to using checks. Also, sometimes the office would receive packages and not notify you that they had the package. Lastly, there were about 3 or 4 dumpsters in the parking lot collecting trash because they never emptied them. It's unsightly and smelly. We did not receive quality care or customer service at this community, and we will be moving out at the end of our lease.

Report
Resident
2014 - 2015 Recommended Property Reviewed 01/23/2015
I've lived here since mid 2014 and today is January 23, 2015. It's a decent place. I'm in a 2br/1ba and it's certainly big enough. Fridge and stove work fine, but are a bit dated. Well, okay, they're ancient but they came free with the apartment so I can't really complain. Never any issues with parking, which is always a concern at an apartment complex in any decent sized city / metro area. I feel safe here too. Haven't heard any gunshots, no fights. I did receive a notice on my door about 1 month ago that there was a break-in. Still, this is a large complex and that's the only note i've gotten about crime here. 1 break in over 3 months is not that bad...then again i moved here from a crappy city where my street had 14 break ins in 1 year. walls are paper thin. absolutely paper thin. my upstairs neighbor received a skype call the other night. i know this because i could hear the little skype ringtone, and answer "hey girl". i can hear every footstep they take, every toilet they flush, and every time they run the sink. but it's an apartment. not going to be silent. it's tolerable for sure. best thing about this complex is the prime location. 1-2 minute drive from southpoint mall, imax theater, countless restaurants and grocery stores, 10 minutes to RTP, 1 minute from I40, just the most perfect location. overall i do recommend if you can get over the paper thin walls. p.s. as another poster said that trash is often overflowing and there is dog crap everywhere. hence the low grounds rating.

The cops are here frequently and there was just a fight in the parking lot last night!!!!!!!!!!!. Break ins happen all the time( they do send out a newsletter that reminds you to lock your doors though lol) Next lets talk about the roaches!!!! and I'm not taking about small roaches either I'm talking about the big daddies the COCK ROACHES. I am a very clean person and I have never had to live amongst roaches so it was very disheartening to keep finding these monsters in my apartment. When I brought it up to the staff the manager ----- was so nonchalant I could tell this was a reoccurring problem that she was used to dealing with ... we're talking about COCK ROACHES people!!!!!!!!! She offered to put me on the pest control list however, I pay a pest control fee monthly shouldn't pest control be mandatory for all apartments? ----- is also very rude BTW. Maintenance never truly fixes anything because it breaks again shortly after they leave but they do come out in a timely fashion. Mold grows around my windows and they just spray paint over it. I pay too much money in rent to put up with all of this. I consider it a lesson learned.

Verified Manager10/10/2014

Thank you for the kind words about Colonial Village at Woodlake! We are so happy that you decided to join us here! Thank you again for the positive feedback, and please let us know if there is anything we can do to make your stay with us even better.

How was this review?
Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Resident
2013 - 2014 Not Recommended Reviewed 09/23/2014
Oh man, where do I even start?! I moved out of this piece of crap apartment within the past 45 days. I was literally counting down the days until I could move. My room mate and I affectionately started referring to this place as "Colonial Dump" for the following reasons: The trash situation is out of control and completely unsanitary. There is only one trash compactor for this rather large complex, and there is not a day that it is not overflowing. It smells really nice in the summertime. There are lots of roaming cats dining at the trash dump to play with while taking your garbage out. Also, the residents have no idea what the difference between trash and recycling is and so there is always a ton of trash in the recycling containers. This may also be because the compactor is so full there is no where else to put the trash. My apartment had a certain...smell. That smell was mildew. I had to toss some of my furniture and wash ALL of my linens and clothes in vinegar when I moved to a new complex to kill that smell off. I also had to wash my hair way more often because the smell would get caught in my hair. So where was that mildew smell coming from!? Probably from the leak in the roof that would drip onto the carpet in my apartment. How in the hell my ceiling leaked when I wasn't on the top floor I will never know. What else leaked you may ask? Well, the dishwasher certainly did. I found water on the floor many times. I also had maintenance enter my apartment at one point because of a possible leak from the upstairs apartment. My A/C also leaked, it leaked fluid all over the carpet and it smelled AWFUL. The complex then steam cleaned the carpet but it did not touch that smell or help in the slightest. They also made sure to charge me to clean the carpets upon move-out. One thing that didn't leak was the storm drains outside the complex stairs...it didn't drain not a drop of water and you basically needed a bridge to leave the complex. I'm talking a three foot wide, 5 inch deep puddle. The A/C also broke down during my stay. A window unit was provided, and then left in my window for days after the A/C was fixed -- safety hazard. Speaking of safety... I never felt safe in this neighborhood and I work in the public housing neighborhoods of Durham (so I'm no wimp). On more than one occasion I got a notice of break-in. Someone was shot on the property per another notice. I came home one day around 11p to find around 6 police cars in the parking lot in front of my door. Furthermore, I called the police several times myself because of the drunken parties going on in the surrounding apartments on a random weeknight. I would have been cool if it was on a weekend, but 1am on a weeknight is a bit much. Another time I was woken from my sleep by a screaming child and when I went outside I found a 2 year old roaming the parking lot. Let's just say that I had words with his mother when I located her and CPS might have had words later. The very first night I was there some ratchet woman was beating on my bedroom window like I owed her money. I also had about 6 complete strangers knock on my door throughout the year. A little more about the noisy neighbors...this place is just noisy in general, not even just because of the NCCU students having parties. I had a family with young kids living above me and I heard every jump, hop, skip, and fall those kids took. I like kids. These kids were just being kids, nothing unusual. But the floors just are not well insulated and I heard it all...then he got a drum for Christmas and all hope of ever sleeping in on Saturday was lost. Let's talk dog poop -- it's every where. I get that it shouldn't be the apartment community's responsibility to scoop it up -- but if the residents are not doing it, then it probably should be someone else. Having dog poo all over the yard is smelly and gross. If you are afraid of dogs, this isn't the complex for you. There are severallllll pit bull type dogs. I love dogs, so no sweat for me...just a heads up. How is the parking situation!? TERRIBLE. You get a pass and a visitor pass, but good luck parking anywhere near where you live if you have to come home after 6pm. You have to park in China and take a boat across the sea to get home. And if you have a friend who comes by and you forget to hand them the pass, they will get towed (good for residents, bad for guest). Ok ok ok let's review the things that were ok to nice about the place. It was in a good location. Nice running trails across the street, just a mile from a kick---- Kroger, and just a hop on over to Southpoint (if you like shopping). There is a really nice pool on site. The staff in the office are really pleasant and were very friendly when I'd go to pick up packages, they also did seem concerned any time I had a maintenance request. Paying rent online is convenient and you can also make requests for maintenance online. Overall, this community isn't MacDougal Terrace or anything but it's far from satisfactory.

But the floors just are not well insulated and I heard it all...then he got a drum for Christmas and all hope of ever sleeping in on Saturday was lost. Let's talk dog poop -- it's every where. I get that it shouldn't be the apartment community's responsibility to scoop it up -- but if the residents are not doing it, then it probably should be someone else. Having dog poo all over the yard is smelly and gross. If you are afraid of dogs, this isn't the complex for you. There are severallllll pit bull type dogs. I love dogs, so no sweat for me...just a heads up. How is the parking situation!? TERRIBLE. You get a pass and a visitor pass, but good luck parking anywhere near where you live if you have to come home after 6pm. You have to park in China and take a boat across the sea to get home. And if you have a friend who comes by and you forget to hand them the pass, they will get towed (good for residents, bad for guest). Ok ok ok let's review the things that were ok to nice about the place. It was in a good location. Nice running trails across the street, just a mile from a kick---- Kroger, and just a hop on over to Southpoint (if you like shopping). There is a really nice pool on site. The staff in the office are really pleasant and were very friendly when I'd go to pick up packages, they also did seem concerned any time I had a maintenance request. Paying rent online is convenient and you can also make requests for maintenance online. Overall, this community isn't MacDougal Terrace or anything but it's far from satisfactory. Read less

Resident
2014 Not Recommended Reviewed 09/14/2014
I was very pleased with my first visit. The staff member who took care of us was professional and courteous and knowledgeable. We visited first in early June and decided to make CV our home later that month. We signed a reservation agreement in late June, and I was under the assumption that the leasing agent who assisted us would be in contact with us with the actual lease documents. Well, we all know what happens when one assumes. Our old lease ran out on August 31st, and I was not able to get in contact with CV until August 21st. After that, every ounce of professionalism, knowledge and promptness I experienced at my first visit went out the window. There is absolutely no communication between agents in that office, leading to us having to submit documentation twice (and more in some cases), repeatedly ask for maintenance that was meant to be done BEFORE we moved in to be completed, and having our lease re-drawn not once, not twice, but THREE times before everything was correct. This office boasts that it is open 7 days a week for residents' convenience, but on Sunday September 7th, my roommate and I spent an hour and a half waiting outside for the leasing agent to arrive. The posted hours were from 1pm to 5pm, and the leasing agent did not arrive until half past 2pm. The only notice we had was a sign on the door saying "We will return at 1pm". This is completely ridiculous. There are, at the time of this writing, only two leasing agents that I know of working that office, and only one full time maintenance guy. How can three people run a property of this size? They can't. Is this MAA's staffing blunder, or is it CV's seeming lack of sensible management? Either way, I am and have been completely unsatisfied and shall not renew my lease term. I have been sharing this saga with all of my friends so that in the future MAA/CV can understand exactly how customer service works. Because it doesn't seem that they get it right now.

I have lived here since 1998 and have experienced many changes during time. When I moved in that property was fairly new and now it has aged. Currently there is an upswing in the quality of upkeep, with more attention to power washing stairs and decks/porches plus white siding. We have the beginnings of a fresh new look. There are more residents moving in making the level of people who care about their surroundings greater and helping with the overall feeling of community for all of us. This property is located well in relation to colleges, public schools, and lots of shopping plus is close to Interstate 40 making it possible for residents to work and play both in Durham and surrounding cities. There is a lack of places for children to play, however a city park is adjacent to the property and on the same side of the street. I have always received a very quick response to requests for repairs and have found the office staff to be very friendly. One must keep cars well locked as well as their apartments, and that is true of any property in the area. We have great celebrations for major holidays in the summer especially with pool parties, food and entertainment. Come and visit this property, you will find a good place to live!!

Resident
2006 - 2007 Recommended Property Reviewed 01/01/2007
My husband and I have lived here for 9 months now, and we are very pleased! It is safe, pleasant, convenient, and a great value for the money. We have a dog and a cat, so it's really nice to be at such a pet-friendly apartment complex. The lake and trails in the area are perfect for us, not to mention the city dog park one block away. Convenient to both of our workplaces (RTP) and to Southpoint mall, grocery stores, restaurants, freeway, etc. The apartment staff are always helpful and reliable. They take our packages for us when we're away and get things in the apartment fixed on time. They also respond to us by phone or e-mail when we have a concern or question. They also host events for the community such as summer pool party, holiday festival for kids and community yard sale. I like the guest suite at the complex, which we can reserve for our out-of-town guests at such a reasonable rate. The only downside to the apartment complex is that the mailbox is located far from our apartment door. Overall, I highly recommend this place to people who want a good value for their money and/or who are new to the area.

2004 - 2005 Not Recommended Reviewed 05/11/2005
Upon first moving in we were a little frightened at some of the people loitering about the parking lot, however, most of our fears proved to be unfounded after settling in. I wish I could still say that. I am in total agreement with the exodus of good tenants and the influx of some less than desirable neighbors. Although nothing serious has occured yet there is the ever-present feeling of not being entirely safe. Between blaring car stereos, excruciatingly loud mini-bikes racing through the parking lot at all hours, various episodes of screaming from the parking lot, and shady people hanging about it is very easy to conclude that this is a completely different complex than the one we moved into over a year ago.<br> The rent is reasonable although it was supposed to have been raised by nearly two hundred dollars upon our lease renewal. The office did work with us in regards to that. To that extent the office and maintenance staff are comprised of the most helpful and friendly of staff. Sometimes it takes a few attempts to resolve issues but for the most part they are more than willing to help.<br> Outside of the downgrade in tenants, parking is an absolutely painful situation especially at night when everyone is home as it is not assigned and is a virtual free for all. You will also have to deal with insects though the complex does try to control them. Even on the third floor there is an unbelievable amount of insects present and I won't even go into the issues downstairs tenants have had. There was also a minor problem with mice.<br> Ultimately Parkside is not an atrocious place to reside, however, there are tradeoffs. If you're comfortable with a sometimes sketchy atmosphere with some shady types lurking about and can handle them yelling at each other than this is your place. It is surrounded by a beautiful neighborhood with a jogging trail around a lake and an unbelievable dog park just up the way, however, Parkside appears to be the relative of that neighborhood that others would rather pretend didn't exist. <br><br><br><br><br>

I'm a young female who lives alone, therefore safety is paramount in my decision to choose an apartment- which is why I won't be renewing my lease. Other than that, here are some good points and some bad points. <br> <br>Good points: <br> <br>*The office and maintenance staff are great. I've had a few maintenance issues which were resolved on the first try without a problem. The office staff have been friendly and accomodating to my needs (which are sometimes odd, but not much, and I appreciate their help). <br> <br>*Great location. Great location. Great location. The walking path is within walking distance. The bike path is within biking distance. And Starbucks is but a minute away by car. <br> <br>*The actual neighborhood where the apartments are situated is a wonderful neighborhood full of very friendly people. <br> <br>*The apartments themselves have a great layout, and are well kept. <br> <br>Bad points: <br> <br>There is a caution here about the safety issue- I am not an easily frightened person, but this is too much. <br> <br>*The people that live there. When I first moved in there were a lot of really nice people who lived there. For the past year I've been watching all those people move away (I wish I had known their feelings before signing my lease). I've seen people escorted from their apartments in handcuffs by the police. *Shady* people are always loitering outside of the apartments more and more often, I've found that I do not go outside without my dog after 10 p.m., because people are always hanging out outside my door on the stairwell (I live on the ground floor by a stairwell). <br> <br>*The people are noisy. People will yell to the third floor in the middle of the night, and cars are always blaring music. This is a different type of noise than one encouters in a regular apartment. <br> <br>*Parking is horrendous (I do not know if this is from a relative lack of parking, or people are just too lazy to walk the extra ten yards for a dedicated space.). <br> <br>*I've seen babies in the pool with diapers on- which is disgusting. Children run around without any supervision; I oftentimes see them looking into my apartment or teasing my dog through the windows. <br> <br>Like I said, there are good points and bad points, but safety is the most important to me. <br> <br>

Leasing

The location is everything at Woodlake Reserve, where our prime positioning offers the best of both worlds. Woodlake Reserve is quietly nestled just 2 miles from the excitement of outdoor shopping, premiere upscale retailers, movie theaters, laid-back dining and lively entertainment at The Streets at Southpoint and Main Street. At Colonial Village at Woodlake our peaceful community is both a haven for relaxation and a magnet for the adventurous.
